content.body:
> <@littledan:matrix.org> client monitoring in general? I'm curious whether Steve Hicks 's effort is for refining present monitoring, or making a new system that doesn't exist yet.

In general. There’s some degree of browser tracing presently, but not nearly the maturity of servers. I agree that considering all runtime types is best though. Just pointing out server tracers won’t care so much about some of these concerns at they will not impact us.

content.body: I have a PR for the spec infra for the `error` event, PTAL: https://github.com/tc39/proposal-async-context/pull/95
content.formatted_body: I have a PR for the spec infra for the error event, PTAL: https://github.com/tc39/proposal-async-context/pull/95

content.body:
> <@abotella:igalia.com> I have a PR for the spec infra for the `error` event, PTAL: https://github.com/tc39/proposal-async-context/pull/95

did we decide what the semantics would be at runtime for the error event on the web? Is that documented somewhere?
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @abotella:igalia.com
I have a PR for the spec infra for the error event, PTAL: https://github.com/tc39/proposal-async-context/pull/95
did we decide what the semantics would be at runtime for the error event on the web? Is that documented somewhere?

content.body: I don't think we reached a decision, but that PR does what you would expect, even for primitive exceptions
